title: ClientGunMod
content: On this page ClientGunMod This item only works when running on the client. Client Used to create custom functions for guns. Function and properties in the mod overwrite the equivalent in the gun. The mod can have literally anything.

title: GetPart​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> PartService:GetPart( PartType: string-- The name for the category of parts ) → () Get a part type

title: NewPart​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> PartService:NewPart( PartType: string,-- The name for the category of parts Quantity: number,-- Number of copies of the part to be created Part: BasePart -- The part to be copied ) → () Creates a new part type.

title: ReturnPart​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> PartService:ReturnPart( PartType: string,-- The name for the category of parts Part: BasePart -- The part to be returned ) → () Return a part type

title: BodyshotDamage​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> GunStats.BodyshotDamage: number Damage dealt when bullet hits a body part

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Spring:Shove( Force: Vector3 -- The force to shove the spring ) → () Shoves the spring

title: Update​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Spring:Update( dt: number-- The delta time of RenderStepped ) → Vector3 -- The position of the updated spring Updates the spring

title: GetClientGunMod​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> AssetDeliveryService:GetClientGunMod( GunName: string-- The name of the gun ) → ModuleScript -- Return the client gun mod Gets the client mod for a gun

title: GetModel​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> AssetDeliveryService:GetModel( GunName: string-- The name of the gun ) → Model -- Return the clone of the gun model Gets a model clone for a gun

title: GetModule​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> AssetDeliveryService:GetModule( ModuleName: string-- The name of the module ) → ModuleScript -- Return the Module Gets a module by its name

content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> AssetDeliveryService:GetServerGunMod( GunName: string-- The name of the gun ) → ModuleScript -- Return the server gun mod Gets the server mod for a gun

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item only works when running on the server. Server </> AssetDeliveryService:GetStats( GunName: string-- The name of the gun ) → ModuleScript -- Return the module script containing stats of the gun Gets the stats for a gun

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientGun:DerigGunModelViewmodel() → () Derigs the gun model from the Viewmodel

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientGun:Equip() → () Equips the gun

title: GetAimOffset​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientGun:GetAimOffset() → CFrame -- The offset for the Viewmodel, to aim down sights Calculates and returns the aim offset for the Viewmodel to aim down sights

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientGun:LoadAnimations() → () Loads the gun's animations onto the Viewmodel's Animator

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientGun:RigGunModelViewmodel( GunModel: Model -- The gun model ) → () Rigs the gun model to the Viewmodel

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientGun:Unequip() → () Unequips the gun

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.Debounce: boolean Debounce system to not mix up functions

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.Equipped: number Depicts the slot number of the equipped gun

title: Inventory​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.Inventory: table The Player's inventory where guns are stored according to inventory slots

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.Keybinds: table Stores keybinds for player input

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.Player: Player  The LocalPlayer

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.Remote: RemoteEvent  The RemoteEvent used by the Player

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.RemoteEndpoints: table Link remote event responses to methods

title: Viewmodel​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController.Viewmodel: Viewmodel The viewmodel used

title: AddGun​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:AddGun( GunName: string-- The name of the gun to add ) → ClientGun-- Return the Gun Add a gun to inventory

title: CreateKeybind​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:CreateKeybind( KeybindName: string,-- The keybind name KeyCode: Enum.KeyCode | Enum.UserInputType,-- The keybind keycode or mouse button Type: string,-- Type of keybind SlotNumber: number | nil-- Slot number of where the gun is, if keybind type is equip ) → () Create a new keybind with keycode

title: EquipGun​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:EquipGun( SlotNumber: number-- The number of the slot, where the gun is ) → () Equip a gun in inventory

title: GetGunFromKeybind​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:GetGunFromKeybind( KeybindName: string-- The keybind name ) → ClientGun-- Return the Gun Get a gun from the respective keybind

title: HandleAimInput​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:HandleAimInput( ActionName: string,-- The name of the action InputState: Enum.UserInputState, InputObject: Enum.UserInputType ) → Enum.ContextActionResult Handle gun aim input

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:HandleEquipInput( ActionName: string,-- The name of the action InputState: Enum.UserInputState, InputObject: Enum.UserInputType ) → Enum.ContextActionResult Handle gun equip input

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:RemoveKeybind( KeybindName: string-- The keybind name ) → () Remove an existing keybind

title: UnequipGun​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> ClientController:UnequipGun( SlotNumber: number-- The number of the slot, where the gun is ) → () Unequip a gun in inventory

title: Aiming​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.Aiming: boolean Whether viewmodel is aim down sights or not

title: AimOffset​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.AimOffset: CFrameValue  CFrameValue which holds the aim offset for the viewmodel

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.ClassName: string Name of the class

title: ClientController​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.ClientController: ClientController The local ClientController

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.Enabled: boolean Whether viewmodel is enabled or not

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.OldCameraCf: CFrame  Used for camera animations with viewmodel

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.previousSineX: number Used by viewmodel bobbing

content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.previousSineY: number Used by viewmodel bobbing

title: Rig​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.Rig: Model  The Model, parented to the Camera

title: sinValue​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.sinValue: number Used by viewmodel bobbing

title: StrafeSpring​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.StrafeSpring: Spring Spring used for strafing of viewmodel

title: SwaySpring​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel.SwaySpring: Spring Spring used for swaying of viewmodel

title: AimIn​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel:AimIn() → () Gets the aim offset for the equipped gun, and tweens the aim offset of the viewmodel accordingly

title: AimOut​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel:AimOut() → () Tweens the aim offset of the viewmodel to default

title: CalculateSine​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel:CalculateSine( speed: number, intensity: number ) → CFrame -- Return the calculated sine cframe Calculate sine cframe based on speed and intensity

title: CreateRig​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel:CreateRig() → () Gets a viewmodel clone, and parent's it to the Camera

title: DestroyRig​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel:DestroyRig() → () Destroys the viewmodel, which was parented to the Camera

title: Lerp​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel:Lerp( a: number,-- Number a b: number,-- Number b t: number ) → number-- The lerped result Lerps between number a and number b based on t

title: Update​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> Viewmodel:Update( dt: number-- The delta time of render stepped ) → () Updates the cframe of the viewmodel
